content.raw:
Quoting from the Gazebo Wiki

> While URDFs are a useful and standardized format in ROS, they are lacking many features and have not been updated to deal with the evolving needs of robotics. URDF can only specify the kinematic and dynamic properties of a single robot in isolation. URDF can not specify the pose of the robot itself within a world. **It is also not a universal description format since it cannot specify joint loops (parallel linkages), and it lacks friction and other properties.** Additionally, it cannot specify things that are not robots, such as lights, heightmaps, etc.*

We are trying to build a parallel mechanism where two joints have the same child but different parents or a closed loop with joints that form a parallel mechanism however when we load that model in Gazebo I get

```
Exception [Model.cc:658] can't have two joint with the same name

Error [Model.cc:153] LoadJoint Failed
```

Are parallel mechanisms supported in Gazebo 1.9.0?

If not, are there any plans on adding that functionality in the near future? Is such a functionality easily integrated in the current status of Gazebo?
